details:
It was discovered that there was a read overflow vulnerability in the dhcpcd5 network management protocol client.


* [CVE-2019-11579](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-11579)
dhcp.c in dhcpcd before 7.2.1 contains a 1-byte read overflow with DHO\_OPTSOVERLOADED.


For Debian 8 Jessie, these problems have been fixed in version
6.0.5-2+deb8u1. Thanks to Roy Marples <roy@marples.name>.


We recommend that you upgrade your dhcpcd5 packages.


Further information about Debian LTS security advisories, how to apply
these updates to your system and frequently asked questions can be
found at: <https://wiki.debian.org/LTS>
